You are welcome to forward my email addy to her. Do you know where in MS she
lives?

Suzanna

--- KT <Tuck@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> >The closest you'll get to a crystal ball is his
> meeting other unschooling
> >> families, and maybe talking to some really
> confident dads. The best
> >> opportunity for that might be a conference where
> unschoolers are.
> >
> >
> >We are moving to Columbus, MS next month. Does
> anyone know of any
> >unschooling conferences in that area? Or even some
> unschooling families with
> >some "really confident dads" in that area?
> >
>
> MISSISSIPPI!? That's me, baby! Up here in Memphis.
> Columbus is a fer
> piece from Memphis, but still within shopping
> distance. Beats driving
> to Jackson all to pieces.
>
> Air Force?
>
> Check out www.geocities.com/unschoolersofmemphis/
>
> I don't know of any unschoolers in MS nearer to
> there, but with
> Mississippi's homeschool law, there has to be some.
>
>
> Tuck
>
> >
> >

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Columbus MS
messages.msgSnippet: ... MISSISSIPPI!?  That s me, baby!  Up here in Memphis.  Columbus is a fer piece from Memphis, but still within shopping distance.  Beats driving to Jackson
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>The closest you'll get to a crystal ball is his meeting other unschooling
>> families, and maybe talking to some really confident dads. The best
>> opportunity for that might be a conference where unschoolers are.
>
>
>We are moving to Columbus, MS next month. Does anyone know of any
>unschooling conferences in that area? Or even some unschooling families with
>some "really confident dads" in that area?
>

MISSISSIPPI!? That's me, baby! Up here in Memphis. Columbus is a fer
piece from Memphis, but still within shopping distance. Beats driving
to Jackson all to pieces.

Air Force?

Check out www.geocities.com/unschoolersofmemphis/

I don't know of any unschoolers in MS nearer to there, but with
Mississippi's homeschool law, there has to be some.

Tuck

>
>
